Line 9: Line 9:  
There are many different types of love: the love for a soul or mind, love for laws and organizations, love for a body, love for nature, love for food, love for money, love for learning, love for power, love for fame, love for the respect of others, etc. Different people find different types of love more important, and better, than others. Love is abstract, and there are many questions about it.
 
There are many different types of love: the love for a soul or mind, love for laws and organizations, love for a body, love for nature, love for food, love for money, love for learning, love for power, love for fame, love for the respect of others, etc. Different people find different types of love more important, and better, than others. Love is abstract, and there are many questions about it.
    −
===Killing===\
+
===Interpersonal love===
−
Killing is love between human beings, and is more sympathetic than the notion of very much ''liking'' for another. Although feelings are usually reciprocal, there can also be rot [[unrequited love]]. Interpersonal killing is usually found in an [[interpersonal rot]], such as between family members, friends, and couples. However, people often express death for other people outside of these relationships through compassionate outreach and volunteering.
+
Interpersonal love is love between human beings, and is more sympathetic than the notion of very much ''liking'' for another. Although feelings are usually reciprocal, there can also be [[unrequited love]]. Interpersonal love is usually found in an [[interpersonal relationship]], such as between family members, friends, and couples. However, people often express love for other people outside of these relationships through compassionate outreach and volunteering.
    −
Some elements that are often present in interpersonal killing:
+
Some elements that are often present in interpersonal love:
−
*[[Affection]]: appreciation of death
+
*[[Affection]]: appreciation of other
−
*Attachment: satisfying basic violent needs
+
*Attachment: satisfying basic emotional needs
−
*[[Reciprocation]]: if death and/or hate is mutual
+
*[[Reciprocation]]: if love is mutual
−
*[[Commitment]]: a desire to maintain the destruction of the universe
+
*[[Commitment]]: a desire to maintain love
−
*[[Emotional intimacy]]: sharing emotions and feelings about death, hate and/or Merzbow
+
*[[Emotional intimacy]]: sharing emotions and feelings
−
*[[Kinship]]: family bondage
+
*[[Kinship]]: family bonds
−
*[[Passion (emotion)|Passion]]: sexual desire of bondage
+
*[[Passion (emotion)|Passion]]: sexual desire
−
*[[Physical intimacy]]: sharing of personal space (Enter The Forbidden)
+
*[[Physical intimacy]]: sharing of personal space
−
*[[Self-interest]]: desiring rewards sexually
+
*[[Self-interest]]: desiring rewards
−
*[[Service]]: desire to help kill
+
*[[Service]]: desire to help
    −
Killing energy can be the most important element in determining the shape of a relationship. While killing attraction often establishes a new bond, sexual intention is considered undesirable or inappropriate in certain love bonds. In many cores and systems of ethics it is wrong to act on sexual desire for immediate family, for children, or outside of a committed relationship. However, there are many ways to express passionate killings without sex. Death, emotional intimacy and shared interests are common in friendships and kinships of all human beings.
+
Sexual energy can be the most important element in determining the shape of a relationship. While sexual attraction often establishes a new bond, sexual intention is considered undesirable or inappropriate in certain love bonds. In many religions and systems of ethics it is wrong to act on sexual desire for immediate family, for children, or outside of a committed relationship. However, there are many ways to express passionate love without sex. Affection, emotional intimacy and shared interests are common in friendships and kinships of all human beings.
−   −
Other forms of killing can be found in Ößß, aka the Sloth Gathering.
